title: 110_s2994
content: The Act may be cited as the "Great Lakes Legacy Act of 2008" and focuses on the remediation of sediment contamination in areas of concern. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to include clauses related to innovative approaches for sediment contamination remediation and aquatic habitat restoration. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to prioritize projects for contaminated sediment remediation that are ready to be implemented and use innovative approaches or technologies. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act prioritizes projects for contaminated sediment remediation that are ready for implementation and utilize innovative approaches or technologies, including remediation to be started within one year of receiving funds. Additional consideration may be given to projects funded by potentially responsible parties. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act prioritizes contaminated sediment remediation projects that are ready for implementation and use innovative approaches or technologies. Projects funded by potentially responsible parties may receive additional consideration. Projects funded by potentially responsible parties may receive additional consideration, including funds paid or in-kind services provided, evaluated based on site-specific merits and added value. Projects funded by potentially responsible parties may receive additional consideration, including funds paid or in-kind services provided, evaluated based on site-specific merits and added value. Amendments include improving the scope of remediation, employing innovative methods, accelerating the process, and allowing non-Federal sponsors to pay the Administrator for project costs. The Administrator may enter into an agreement with a non-Federal sponsor for advance payment and reimbursement costs for project expenses. The Administrator can enter into an agreement with a non-Federal sponsor for project expenses, including defining potentially responsible parties and increasing funding from $50,000,000 to $150,000,000 for fiscal years 2009 through 2013. SEC. 3. PUBLIC INFORMATION PROGRAM. Section 118(c)(13) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to include a public information and participation program for the remediation of contaminated sediment in areas of concern. The Administrator will work with various entities to provide grants for outreach activities related to this program. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to include a program for remediation of contaminated sediment in areas of concern in the United States from 2009 through 2013. The Great Lakes Legacy Act of 2002 is amended to extend the research and development program from 2009 through 2013.
